intro: Commelina saltiana, commonly known as the salt marsh morning glory, is a flowering plant native to coastal areas of the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant thrives in saline and wetland environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh coastal conditions. Its rapid growth and ability to spread through rhizomes make it a common invasive species in salt marshes. Commelina saltiana plays an important ecological role by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms.
